channel.title: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE
channel.description:
So I'm getting a new phone and It's out of the Samsung Galaxy S4, iPhone 5 or HTC ONE. Now, I will be using it for a lot of social media, viewing forums and stuff. Watching vids, music and messaging and calling obviously. And a few games, now what would be the best (No budget getting on a Plan).
Thanks.

item.title: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

you dont need a mac to develop ios apps. there’s plenty of open source/free wrappers. however, a mac is more friendly to ios.

android has a lot more flaws than ios does.

Read full topic
item.source: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE

item.title: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:34, topic:529155”]whether they sign a 2 year contract or pay full price, they’re paying the same (or very close) price for the phone

month-to-month is a service plan that you can cancel at any time without a termination fee (but will still have to pay for the phone)

if you sign a 2 year contract, you have to pay for the phone and for the service, for at least 2 years, or pay a large sum for the termination.

either way, you’re paying for the phone, and for the service. so that has no relative debate here.

whether or not apple produces the phones for 200 or 600, and sell them for 200 or 600, its their choice. they’re a business and can choose their own prices. it’s obviously working for them because literally everyone wanted one before android started up; and now everyone that knows how retarded android is - wants one.[/quote]

To be honest. I’ve never sided with iOS or android. They’re both shit in their own unique ways.
Sure they have the next ‘big’ features…
But they have so many flaws. iOS is so locked down. You can’t develop apps for it (technically) unless you have a mac computer. They give users little freedom. And so on
Android is way more open, but it’s spell check isn’t good, neither is apples, but androids is more annoying imo (I had an android phone a while back). There’s a lot more hacks, and vulnerabilities on android (I guess that comes with the open source abilities and such). And the android OS loves to do shit it isn’t supposed to (a friend of mine deleted a game from her phone. minutes later it was somehow back on the phone, and running in the background).

Read full topic
item.source: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE

item.title: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

whether they sign a 2 year contract or pay full price, they’re paying the same (or very close) price for the phone

month-to-month is a service plan that you can cancel at any time without a termination fee (but will still have to pay for the phone)

if you sign a 2 year contract, you have to pay for the phone and for the service, for at least 2 years, or pay a large sum for the termination.

either way, you’re paying for the phone, and for the service. so that has no relative debate here.

whether or not apple produces the phones for 200 or 600, and sell them for 200 or 600, its their choice. they’re a business and can choose their own prices. it’s obviously working for them because literally everyone wanted one before android started up; and now everyone that knows how retarded android is - wants one.

Read full topic
item.source: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE

item.title: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:31, topic:529155”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=647911.msg4369981#msg4369981 date=1380401628]
3) They use “Conflict” materials. See: this for more on conflict materials.
And I’m sure you could pull out a lot more issues on the iPhone… Or apple.
[/quote]thats like telling people not to buy diamonds unless they were mined in the us.

not sure what you meant by #2 but you’re paying for the price of the phone whether buying in full or on contract.

also, anything is going to be cheaper to make if you make it in china[/quote]
#2, Apple makes the iPhones for $200. They sell the phones to wireless providers for $650, or whatever that phone costs.
See here for the phone price (It’s the one that says $649.99 w/month to month)
Then Apple has them sell the phone for cheaper (The contract deal), and the companies use the contract to make the money back.

Read full topic
item.source: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE

item.title: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:29, topic:529155”][quote author=chillwitm888 link=topic=647911.msg4367141#msg4367141 date=1379887045]

^ just like the cellular companies “no contract, upgrade whenever”

you’re still paying for the full price of the phone regardless. you’re just not limited to upgrade timeframes.

not really tho
no contract is 649$
and contract is 200+ 90$ per month set on a 2 year contract (average on a single person on sprint and at&T)… 2360$

Wait am I misinterpreting your quote? Or something? Idk
[/quote]who the hell pays $90 a month for the phone, plus $200 down?
my iphone 5 was $150 down + iphone 4 trade-in $15 a month for 24 months = $510 total + an iphone 4 which could have brought in at least $100

iphone 5 fully paid was about $650 total. so i ‘saved’ $40, by trading in a phone. and if i wouldn’t have, i’d be paying even more a month[/quote]
hmm? data is 15 or 25
unlimited texting if on a family plan is 30 for all lines that are on the family plan
voice depends on minutes

700 minutes of family plan 69.99
primary phone included
second phone included
Iphone (per iphone) data plan 15 or 25
family unlimited texting - 30.00
its so easy to pay over 90$+ for one person
my friend pays 90 for his iphone 4 solo
family plan is cheaper over all because everybody can use the unlimited texting
etc incl adding phones
alot of people pay 90$ per month
+200 dollars for contract iphone

Read full topic

item.source: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE

item.title: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:21, topic:529155”][quote author=Chachai link=topic=647911.msg4366114#msg4366114 date=1379719527]
Get a s4 or htc one. Dont deal with apple, their iphones are complete junk. I would strongly super strong agaiasnt iphones. there hoorrible.
[/quote]Because?[/quote]
Because of this:

  1. They sell their phones at full price to companies (the price you see at verizon if you don’t get the 2 year contract).
  2. Their phones only cost $200 to make, and they force companies to sell it for cheaper than they bought it (iPhone 5S 16gb: $199.99 at verizon, and just about any store with a 2 year contract)
  3. They use “Conflict” materials. See: this for more on conflict materials.
    And I’m sure you could pull out a lot more issues on the iPhone… Or apple.

Read full topic
item.source: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE

you’re still paying for the full price of the phone regardless. you’re just not limited to upgrade timeframes.
[/quote]
not really tho
no contract is 649$
and contract is 200+ 90$ per month set on a 2 year contract (average on a single person on sprint and at&T)… 2360$

Wait am I misinterpreting your quote? Or something? Idk[/quote]who the hell pays $90 a month for the phone, plus $200 down?
my iphone 5 was $150 down + iphone 4 trade-in $15 a month for 24 months = $510 total + an iphone 4 which could have brought in at least $100

iphone 5 fully paid was about $650 total. so i ‘saved’ $40, by trading in a phone. and if i wouldn’t have, i’d be paying even more a month

item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

iphone 5c is retarded… its not cheap. idk why its even out…
is 99$ on contract cheap to you? is 549$ w/out contract CHEAP???
Why would anybody in their rightminds spend 549$ on a cheap plastic lower specced, worse cpu/gpu, worse camera, no finger print thing
WHY would You buy a 5c for 549$ when you can get the best for 100$ more…
it makes no sense to me at all… the iphone 5 looks better than 5c…
if i phone 5c was 300-400$ with out contract and free with contract… its worth considering
@vain why did you correct me before about the phone being gold
even apple themselves quote themselves about the phone being gold

item.title: Galaxy S4 Vs. iPhone 5 Vs. HTC ONE
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

I got a free GS4 as an upgrade from T-Mobile used it for a week, and traded it for a new iPhone through a local classifieds website. I like the iPhone 5 much more simply because I feel like it runs much smoother than the GS4. I also didn’t have that pleasant of an experience with the last Galaxy phone I had which was the Galaxy S Vibrant (although it isn’t a fair comparison in the slightest considering it’s a long jump from S to S4 so I’m sure the S4 is much, much better).

Read full topic

the iPhone 5s is champagne not gold. and yeah, I’ll probably be upgrading myself. but it all depends on what is actually in the phone + memory upgrades.
